input_text:
Job Title: Director, Engineering (Onsite)

Location: Overland Park, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Summary:

The Netsmart Engineering Director is responsible for productivity and delivery of web-based development programs for assigned products. They hire, develop and coach associates on an ongoing basis. The Engineering Director serves as the Netsmart technical leader on multiple, significant Netsmart modules or products. They are recognized as a technology and solution visionary within the organization.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintain a fully high-functioning and accountable engineering team. Strategize for and set business operational objectives, business requirements, product roadmaps and related technical specifications. Oversee completion of department goals, strategies and budgets. Interact with customers in the necessary product areas.Effectively and routinely review reporting on operational metrics and status. Make plan changes as needed depending on metrics. Identify need for and drive change in our engineering processes.Oversee budget and accountability for assigned Engineering teams.Document performance. Includes obtaining input from other resources. Take corrective action when needed.Continuously improve skills/knowledge of programming languages, tools, department standards and development industry practices. Understand and be able to apply broader industry knowledge for assigned product.Drive improvements in internal processes. Monitor improvements for effectiveness. Maintain knowledge of industry and department standards, company policy and procedures, and employment regulations

Qualifications:

Education

Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems or Computer Science or equivalent combination of experience and education. 

Specialized Knowledge

Must be able to read, understand, and develop code for web-based programming. This may include Visual Basic, ASP, HTML, SQL and .Net languages. Must understand general programming standards, operating systems, workflow cycles, development life cycle, and terminology. Requires a general understanding of business operations, business terminology, and business communications.

Experience

10+ years programming leadership experience building web based enterprise software products leveraging C#, ASP.NET, & SQL, or specialized training combined with experience. Must demonstrate an ability to see the broader picture of impact of developed processes.Must understand development industry standards and practices. Must be able to demonstrate individual and team work effort in collaborative processes. Understanding of Object Oriented ProgrammingMust live or be willing to reside in the greater KC Metro area

Skills And Abilities

Technical Skills Preferred

ASP (Classic) – Familiar through reading and/or introductory-to-intermediate courses required, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.ASP.NET – Familiar through reading and/or introductory-to-intermediate courses preferred, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.Object-Oriented Programming – Knowledgeable of an object-oriented language (JAVA, Visual Basic, C#, F#). Has done project work using code. Has good working application/experience. Can apply principals to multi-process applications. Generally 1-2 years.VB.NET – Familiar through reading and/or introductory-to-intermediate courses preferred, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.SQL – Familiar through reading and/or introductory-to-intermediate courses required, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.HTML – Familiar through reading and/or introductory-to-intermediate courses required, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.JAVA Script - Familiar through reading or introductory course preferred, including reading and writing simple code and developing simple processes.

Other Skills

Requires the interpersonal skills to interact and collaborate with wide variety of internal personnel. May interact with outside customer or mentor less experienced developers.Requires the ability to work independently and self-initiate to develop, troubleshoot, meet department deadlines, and learn industry and products.Requires the verbal skills to probe and ask questions to ensure understanding of requirements, participate in teams, and communicate technical issues to non-technical personnel.Requires the ability to read and interpret technical documents and write a variety of business and technical documents. Requires strong presentation skills, to every level of internal and external organization.

Travel

Up to 10% domestic travel is expected for this position. This requirement may vary depending on location, and could be up to 25%.

Netsmart is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all associates. All employment decisions at Netsmart, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, promotion and transfer, are based on performance, qualifications, abilities, education and experience. Netsmart does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Netsmart desires to provide a healthy and safe workplace and, as a government contractor, Netsmart is committed to maintaining a drug-free workplace in accordance with applicable federal law. Pursuant to Netsmart policy, all post-offer candidates are required to successfully complete a pre-employment background check, including a drug screen, which is provided at Netsmart’s sole expense. In the event a candidate tests positive for a controlled substance, Netsmart will rescind the offer of employment unless the individual can provide proof of valid prescription to Netsmart’s third party screening provider.

If you are located in a state which grants you the right to receive information on salary range, pay scale, description of benefits or other compensation for this position, please contact myHR@ntst.com to request the details to which you may be legally entitled.

All applicants for employment must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Netsmart does not provide work visa sponsorship for this position.

Experience Level (if available): Director
